stimulusHtml:
Before listening to the first playing, please look at the staff below. Notice that there are nine chords in the progression; the soprano and bass notes and the Roman numeral of the first chord are given.

Remember to notate only the soprano and bass voices and to write, in every blank, the numerals indicating the chords and their inversions.

Now listen to the progression for the first time and begin working.

Enter any notes as you prepare your response.

features.html:
You will hear a harmonic progression in four parts. The progression will be played four times. There will be a pause of 30 seconds after the first playing and a one-minute pause after each subsequent playing. Please do the following:

  1. Notate only the soprano and bass voices. Do not notate the alto and tenor voices.

  2. On the blanks provided under the staff, write in the Roman and Arabic numerals that indicate the chords and their inversions. (Each blank should contain at least a Roman numeral, a figure, or a dash.)

  3. Make sure to align your notes with the blanks provided.

stimulusHtml:
<style type="text/css"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}-->
</style>
Upload your final response.
